main.name: Mario Merino
main.description: During my free time i enjoy reading books and improving my skills feel free to look around!
main.bio: Strong Frontend and Full Stack Engineer with experienced understanding of the core programming fundamentals looking for a great opportunity to put my talents to use. Team player with good communication skills who is flexible and ready to work alongside a passionate team of developers. I live and breathe tech and am constantly honing my skills to solve bigger and better problems.

education.description: Thorough education in the underlying theory, concepts, and science behind more complex programming. It was here that I discovered my passion for scalable application programming (web and mobile), the security behind computer and application systems, and found that I had a knack for web development

work.title: Lead Frontend Engineer
work.description: Responsible for creating new web applications to be used internally by the university by staff and students while maintaining WCAG 2.0 Accessibility AA Working within dotCMS using a headless cms approach to create and implement different functionality to web pages and web applications with react on the frontend.

work.company: University of Texas Health Science Center
work.title: Web Developer III
work.description: Responsible for creating new web applications to be used internally by the university by staff and students while maintaining WCAG 2.0 Accessibility AA Working within dotCMS using a headless cms approach to create and implement different functionality to web pages and web applications with react on the frontend.

work.title: Full Stack Engineer
work.description: Responsible for technical SEO and maintaining LKQ websites fixing bugs and applying updates and adding features as needed, tasked with creating front end interface of a b2b web application for APO division.

work.title: Front End Developer
work.description: Designed Developed & Launched several web applications using various technologies but mostly worked with React, Node, and Redux. Worked on several large and small scale applications focusing on maintenance, security, and efficiency of different web applications focused on making pages highly scalable and created high traffic solutions.

skills.name: Typescript
skills.description: I use Git for all of my projects so far. I have used Git for version control in small teams and have toyed around with contributing to Open Source Projects

skills.name: GraphQL
skills.description: Javascript was my first programming language that I started using in college years ago. It is by far the language I am most familiar with in terms of data-structure.

skills.name: Vue
skills.description: I am in love with React It has grown on me and quickly became my go to js library this site was made with React along with several of my project

skills.name: Node JS
skills.description: Node JS is my server-side scripting language of choice. The bulk of my experience with it has been in conjunction with MeteorJS-based projects

skills.name: Python
skills.description: I use Express as my go to framework for node. It is my favorite becasue it is fast, non-opinionated and minimalistic. In my opinion it offers a simpler interface for creating my request endpoints,

skills.name: React / React Native / Electron
skills.description: I have used many different database systems and I am better educated and experienced with Relational Databases. However, for many applications, the ease of use of MongoDB better suits my needs

skills.name: Mapbox
skills.description: I use Semantic-UI more often than not when creating sites.Being able to handpick the components i actually need helps me reduce file size/load time not to mention the ease of customization

skills.name: Amazon Web Services
skills.description: I use Netlify as my hosting platform for most of my projects because so far they are all unpaid and their free tier is convenient. I also appreciate its integration with Github for such simple deployment.
